notes: unless otherwise indicated in the 'notes', the 'result' is independent of the use of the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plug-in - https://plugins.qgis.org/plugins/gml_application_schema_toolbox/

gml_WFS2_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema toolbox' plugin

gml_WFS2_display.notes: need to use the 'GML application schema toolbox' plugin

gml_features_edit.notes: need to use the 'GML Application schema toolbox' plugin. There is no possibility to save edits in the source gml dataset nor to save edited layer as a new GML dataset preserving the INSPIRE structure. The 'Load in relational mode (GMLAS)' and the 'Load from GMLAS database' options allow updating relevant DB tables (SQLite or PostgreSQL).

gml_features_create.notes: need to use 'GML Application schema toolbox' plugin. However, for the new geometries there is no possibility to edit the '_xml_' field nor to save edited layer as a new GML dataset preserving the INSPIRE structure(in case you use the 'Load in XML mode' option). When using the 'Load in relational mode (GMLAS)' and 'Load from GMLAS database' options, only way to insert the INSPIRE feature properties is to modify each relevant layer (i.e. DB table). This is quite complicated because with INSPIRE schemas you have tens of tables.

gml_geometry_load.notes: also when geometries are 'hidden' in complex data types, such in the case of the AD theme

gml_geometry_display.notes: also when geometries are 'hidden' in complex data types, such in the case of the AD theme

gml_mixed_geometry_load.notes: Only NOT USING the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_mixed_geometry_display.notes: Only NOT USING the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin - One layer provided for each geometry type

gml_multiple_geometry_load.notes: need to use the GML Application schema plugin. Tested both with multiple geometries in different properties (ef:representativePoint)and multiple occurrences of the same geometry property (ad:geographicPosition). The behaviour with Ad is tested using the file 'AD.Spain_full-2geographicPositions.gml'

gml_multiple_geometry_display.notes: need to use the GML Application schema toolbox plugin. Multiple occurrences of the same geometry property are displayed only using the 'Load in relational mode (GMLAS)' or the 'Load from GMLAS database' options. Multiple geometries in different properties are displayed no matter the load option selected and in different layers.

gml_geometry_3d_load.notes: 3d coordinates are loaded correctly if both the srsName and the srsDimension attributes are set. If the srsDimension attribute is not specified, the tool works correctly only in case of point geometries. Incorrect results - z dimension dropped- for linestring and polygons

gml_geometry_3d_display.notes: 3d coordinates are displayed correctly if both the srsName and the srsDimension attributes are set. If the srsDimension attribute is not specified, the tool works correctly only in case of point geometries. Incorrect results - z dimension dropped- for linestring and polygons

gml_complex_property_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_complex_property_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin.

gml_multiple_occurrences_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_multiple_occurrences_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_xnil_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_xnil_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_nilreason_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_nilreason_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_xlinks_resolve.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin. It is possible to resolve the external links (as ‘embedded’ description or ‘new layer’), the internal links (#) are NOT resolved.
